title: Mum admits lying that school gave son a tuna sandwich
text:
Stacy Jarvis publicly accused the school of forcing her nine-year-old son to go all day ‘without food’ because he was only offered a tuna sandwich which he doesn’t like (Picture: MEN)

A mother who claimed her son’s school made him eat a tuna sandwich instead of a hot meal because he ‘took his time’ on the toilet has admitted the story wasn’t true.

Stacy Jarvis, 31, publicly accused the school of forcing Jayden, nine, to go all day ‘without food’ because he doesn’t like tuna.

But she has now backtracked and admitted her son was in fact offered a hot meal before he turned down the sandwich.

Mum-of-four Stacy claims she didn’t know Jayden was actually offered a Shepherd’s Pie first during lunch time at Thanet Primary School before he refused.

She claims she only found out the truth after the story broke when her son’s headteacher wrote her a letter.

The head said Stacy ‘knew full well’ Jayden had been offered Shepherd’s Pie first when she decided to go to the press.

Stacy maintains that she was not told this by anyone at the school before the letter came on Monday.

Stacy said her son only admitted the truth to her after the school wrote to her saying he was offered both a hot meal and a sandwich but refused both (Picture: MEN)

She said: ‘He said that when he went the dinner lady gave him the Shepherds Pie and he said “I don’t like that” and that’s when they gave him the tuna sandwich and he said “I don’t like that”.

‘He said they said “It’s either that or nothing”, that’s what he just told me.

‘I really don’t know why the school didn’t say that in the first place. I don’t know why [the headteacher] hasn’t said anything to me in person.’

Stacy said she would not have been so upset if she had known her son was offered the hot meal first.

At the time, she pulled Jayden out of school over the issue but sent him back the next day after being threatened with a fine for unauthorised absence.

She then spoke to the headteacher on the phone once Jayden had gone back to ask for assurances for the future.

But in the letter, which Stacy has given to the press, the headteacher accuses the mother of only speaking to her on the phone to get ‘enough information’ to sell her story.

The head wrote: ‘I went out of my way on Friday, during our telephone conversation, so that we could move forward and put the incident behind us, to ensure the best for Jayden.

‘It has now become apparent that the sole purpose of the conversation was so that you could gain enough information for a follow up newspaper report once again completely based on untruths and misquotes.’

The school said it hoped Stacy adheres to its values of respect, responsibility, kindness, honesty and friendship in the future (Picture: MEN)

Stacy, who is also mum to Alisha, seven, and Cole, five, said she ‘does not know what to do now’.

The letter said her actions caused ‘a great deal of stress and upset’ to all staff at the school.

She has been warned she will be banned from the school site if she is ‘rude’ and ‘aggressive’ again.

In a statement, the school said: ‘Thanet school promotes five key values of respect, responsibility, kindness, honesty and friendship.

‘I have written to Miss Jarvis to request she adheres to these values.’

description: Stacy Jarvis pulled Jayden, nine, out of school claiming he was forced to eat a sandwich instead of a hot dinner despite 'knowing full well' it wasn't true.
